revised_title: Classical Theory of Spinning Particles in a Meson Field: Applications and Implications
tldr: This article presents a classical theory of spinning particles in a meson field, taking into account the effects of radiation reaction on the rotation of the spin. The theory provides a cross-section for the scattering of transversely polarized neutral mesons and explains how the energy spectrum of transversely polarized mesons falls off rapidly for energies below a certain threshold. The results of this study have implications for understanding the behavior of particles in nuclear interactions and the differences between classical and quantum theories.
